content: The Dodd-Frank Act's table of contents is amended to enhance supervision of certain bank holding companies by striking the item relating to section 113 and inserting new information. Section 113 of the Dodd-Frank Act is amended to enhance supervision and regulation of certain nonbank financial companies and bank holding companies. The heading of the section is revised to reflect this authority. The Dodd-Frank Act is amended to enhance supervision and regulation of certain nonbank financial companies and bank holding companies with total assets over $250 billion. These companies will be subject to enhanced supervision and prudential standards by the Board of Governors. The Council will review bank holding companies with assets between $50 billion and $250 billion to determine if they need enhanced supervision by the Board of Governors based on financial distress or other factors. The Financial Stability Council will assess bank holding companies with assets between $50 billion and $250 billion to evaluate if their activities could threaten the financial stability of the United States. Factors considered include the size, interconnectedness, and availability of substitutes for the services provided by the bank holding company. The Financial Stability Council will assess bank holding companies with assets between $50 billion and $250 billion based on factors like size, interconnectedness, and activity complexity. If significant changes occur in a company's activities, a review may be conducted even if it's not subject to enhanced supervision and prudential standards. The Financial Stability Council will review bank holding companies with assets between $50 billion and $250 billion to assess if they pose a threat to the financial stability of the United States. If a company has not been reviewed in 36 months or significant changes occur, a review may be conducted. If a company is determined to require enhanced supervision and prudential standards, written notice will be provided with an explanation of the decision. The Financial Stability Council will review bank holding companies with assets between $50 billion and $250 billion to assess if they pose a threat to the financial stability of the United States. If a company is subject to enhanced supervision and prudential standards, the Council may terminate these measures if it finds that the company's financial distress or activities do not threaten the financial stability of the country. The Financial Stability Council will review bank holding companies with assets between $50 billion and $250 billion to assess if they pose a threat to the financial stability of the United States. If a company is no longer deemed a threat, it will no longer be subject to enhanced supervision and prudential standards. Companies no longer deemed a threat will no longer be subject to enhanced supervision and prudential standards. Amendments are made to various subsections to update terminology and references. The Dodd-Frank Act is amended to enhance supervision of bank holding companies previously determined under section 113 by updating terminology and references in subsections. Subparagraphs and sections are revised to reflect changes in asset thresholds and final determinations. The Dodd-Frank Act is amended to update terminology and references in subsections related to bank holding companies with assets of $50,000,000,000 or more. Changes include revisions to reflect new asset thresholds and final determinations under section 113. Amendments are made to sections 164 and 165 of the Act. The amendments made by this section regarding the effective date and expedited rulemaking authority for the Financial Stability Oversight Council and the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System. The final regulations must be in place within 180 days of the enactment of the Act and take effect within 1 year of the enactment. The sense of Congress is that asset size is just one factor in determining systemic risk, with more objective processes from the Dodd-Frank Act being a better indicator.
